name: Kamuzu Banda Mausoleum
description: A memorial to Malawi's first president, Dr. Hastings Kamuzu Banda. It features four main pillars that support the dome-shaped roof, representing the four cornerstones of the Malawi Congress Party. The structure and surrounding gardens offer a reflective experience.

name: Lilongwe Wildlife Centre
description: Malawi's only wildlife sanctuary, rescuing and rehabilitating wild animals. It offers guided tours, forest walks, and educational programs. Visitors can see a variety of animals including monkeys, antelopes, and various bird species.

name: Kumbali Cultural Village
description: Experience traditional Malawian village life. Visitors can participate in cooking classes, drumming, dancing, and learn about local customs and crafts. It's a great way to immerse oneself in the rich cultural heritage of Malawi.

name: Old Town Mall
description: A bustling shopping complex in the heart of Lilongwe's Old Town. It hosts a variety of shops, restaurants, and local vendors, offering everything from souvenirs to modern necessities. It's a vibrant hub for both locals and tourists.

name: Chongoni Rock-Art Area
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its rich collection of ancient rock paintings, dating back thousands of years. It provides a fascinating glimpse into the artistic and spiritual lives of early human inhabitants of the region.

name: Lingadzi Namilomba Forest Reserve
description: A protected forest area offering peaceful trails for walking and birdwatching. It's a green lung in the city, providing a habitat for various bird species and small wildlife, perfect for a quiet escape from urban life.

name: Tobacco Auction Floors
description: One of the largest tobacco markets in the world, offering a unique insight into Malawi's primary cash crop industry. During auction season (usually April to September), visitors can witness the vibrant trading process.

name: Parliament Building
description: The modern seat of Malawi's legislative body. Its architecture is impressive, and guided tours are sometimes available, offering a look into the country's governance. The surrounding area is well-maintained and provides a sense of civic pride.
